review_title: One of the Worst Job Experiences I've Ever Had
pros: Good pay, the students are nice
cons: Was made to feel constantly confused about what I should be doing and how I should be doing it: -Dept. Manager went on vacation during my second week. I continued taking phone calls and running reports like I had been shown how to do during this time. Was barely given any tasks by the Supervisor. Then Dept. Manager came back and was upset with me for answering the phones and not knowing more even though the Supervisor was well aware I was answering the phones. -Dept. Manager kept changing the rules on whether I was allowed to answer the phone or not. One day I could. The next, not. Then the next day I would be allowed to answer voicemails. Then the next day I couldn't answer the phone at all. Then I was told to answer calls but put them all on hold immediately. Then some days I was told not to answer the phone at all but then told I should answer it if it seemed like no one was going to pick it up. -Dept. Manager would micromanage. They would hear someone assisting me with how to do something and literally interrupt and tell me the exact thing the other person had just said. -I expressed at 3 different times that I was concerned I was not finishing a certain task fast enough and I was never given any advice/criticism other than to focus on quality vs quantity. Then one day I was working on this task and the Dept. Manager said, "I would have had those all done by now." but still never addressed my concerns. -No one seemed to know when we would get to leave. The Dept. Manager would stay later almost every night and other employees would whisper about when they thought they would be able to go home. Because I was new I would stay until I was told I could go, which was usually 30-45min after we were scheduled to leave. -One day I copied a set of notes for a task that the Dept Manager had given me. I didn't change anything from the original notes, but I did number the steps and at the bottom of the page I wrote out what each step meant because I didn't want to make any mistakes the next time I was asked to do this task. I told the Dept. Manager I did this and they became upset with me and told me I couldn't personalize my own personal notes. They looked at the new notes and told me the notes were now wrong. I asked the Dept. Manager to show me where the notes were wrong and reiterated I didn't change anything from the notes they had given me. The Dept. Manager just stared at me for a moment, clearly upset, said "Okay." and walked away. -A couple days after that last incident I came to work and was abruptly let go. I asked why they were letting me go since I was given little to no criticism on my performance. I was told that I didn't go to the Dept. Manager "enough" to ask what I should be doing (although I was always busy working on something) and was told the Dept. Manager didn't see me using my notes "enough". When I tried to argue that these reasons didn't make sense because I could easily point out several times just that week that I did those very things, I was dismissed and told "It's just not good fit."

pros: Great dedicated staff and students
cons: They pay so low and can't figure out what their next step is in terms of a future. losing enrollment, no money to pay employees and needs to have sensitivity training and a commitment that all employees will be treated respectfully and kindly. You would expect a Catholic institution to have a higher standard of employee treatment but the next scandal in the Catholic church is exactly how employees are treated and abused verbally, emotionally and mentally by this institution.  Discrimination runs rampant against woman especially.

job_title: Security Gate Officer in Worcester, MA
pros: Very professional, fully accredited Campus Police Department. Most of the Officers treated me with respect and as part of the team in an effort to keep all those on campus safe. Decent pay and seeming opportunity for advancement. They also made the Security Officers as comfortable as possible, with a security building fully equipped with air conditioning/heating, tv, computer, fridge, and safety features built in.
cons: Standing all day could lead to knee problems. A couple grumpy cops, and having to deal with the drunk antics of 18-20somethings is always fun. Other than that, not much to complain about. Overall a great position.

review_title: Great student job I had for all four years!
job_title: Plourde Recreation Student Employee in Worcester, MA
pros: Working at the Plourde Recreation Center was my first choice when looking for an on-campus student job. It allowed me to learn office tasks, work the front desk, and develop time management when managing the upkeep of several building areas. During down time, I could study or work on homework which was a plus. You can also manage your hours easily.
cons: Open on snow days and pool hours weren't as long as they could be!

pros: Friendly people. It was nice to develop relationships over time. Work was not challenging as a workstudy but sometimes interesting tasks were assigned depending on skills set.
cons: Low pay for students. It is minimum wage and they never increase a cent. However, they try to give extra hours if you are good at what you do.

review_title: Small school but has major highlights
pros: It is a small school so they take care of each other.  You can get tuition remission which is huge!
cons: The small Catholic school can sometimes feel like a small Catholic school.  There is movement toward making the school more Catholic which hasn't been going over very well.

pros: The campus culture and family like dynamic throughout student affairs. Overall really really great experience and happy to be here.
cons: The only downside to working here has been the salary. Overall the work load with the salary can be overwhelming.
